docs.snippet: GENEVA, Switzerland, Aug. 16 (AP) -- As the United Nations Special Committee on Palestine neared the end of its investigations and prepared to draft its report, it appeared almost certain today that a majority of the delegates would recommend some...
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Switzerland, Aug. 16 (AP) -- As the United Nations Special Committee on Palestine neared the end of its investigations and prepared to draft its report, it appeared almost certain today that a majority of the delegates would recommend some form of partition of the Holy Land.

headline.main: PALESTINE PARTITION FAVORED IN U.N. BODY

docs.snippet: PETROPOLIS, Brazil, Aug. 16 -- The new United States proposal for united, collective hemispheric assistance to any American nation attacked by an aggressor appeared on the basis of a canvass today virtually assured of enthusiastic adoption by the...
docs.lead_paragraph: PETROPOLIS, Brazil, Aug. 16 -- The new United States proposal for united, collective hemispheric assistance to any American nation attacked by an aggressor appeared on the basis of a canvass today virtually assured of enthusiastic adoption by the Inter-American Defense Conference.

headline.main: U.S. ACTION CHEERS AMERICAS' LEADERS; Marshall's Plan to Effectuate Hemisphere Security in Pact Seen as a Point for U.N.

docs.lead_paragraph: Frank Cohen, Industrialist and creator of the plan to use Quoddy Village, Me., as a training center where displaced persons from Europe would be prepared for settlement in South America, announced yesterday that only final word from the War Assets Administration prevented his project from getting under way.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 -- The United States and Great Britain agreed today to come to the rescue of London's nearly exhausted dollar resources by temporarily ending free convertibility of sterling to dollars and suspending further withdrawals from the...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 -- The United States and Great Britain agreed today to come to the rescue of London's nearly exhausted dollar resources by temporarily ending free convertibility of sterling to dollars and suspending further withdrawals from the United States loan to Britain.
docs.abstract: comments on modification of Brit sterling conversion program

docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Aug. 21 (AP) -- Financiers and Government leaders of countries inside and outside the British Empire tried today to calculate the "disturbance of trade" that Chancellor of the Exchequer Hugh Dalton forecast last night when he announced the end of convertibility.

headline.main: CONVERSION HALT DISTURBS MARKETS; Australia to Cut Her Imports From U.S. -- Argentina Also Checks Influx of Goods

docs.snippet: PETROPOLIS, Brazil, Aug. 21 -- The economic issues involved in the Inter-American Defense Conference here will come before an urgent plenary session tomorrow in a new form. The development virtually guarantees that a hemispheric economic conference...
docs.lead_paragraph: PETROPOLIS, Brazil, Aug. 21 -- The economic issues involved in the Inter-American Defense Conference here will come before an urgent plenary session tomorrow in a new form. The development virtually guarantees that a hemispheric economic conference will be held in Buenos Aires between July 1 and Dec. 31, 1948.

docs.snippet: Suspension of free convertibility of sterling into dollars, as provided in the new agreement between Great Britain and the United States, is likely to intensify the decline in American exports which began in June. This was the immediate reaction in...
docs.lead_paragraph: Suspension of free convertibility of sterling into dollars, as provided in the new agreement between Great Britain and the United States, is likely to intensify the decline in American exports which began in June. This was the immediate reaction in foreign trade circles here yesterday.
docs.abstract: move seen severe blow to US exports

headline.main: U.S. EXPORT TRADE SEEN THREATENED; Suspension of Free Exchange of Sterling Into Dollars Is Called Severe Blow DECLINE STARTED IN JUNE Other Countries Are Expected to Follow Pattern Set by Britain, Mexico, Brazil
